topProducts.name: Sunrise Curry
topProducts.description: A dairy-free curry dish. The reviewer notes that any curry is a delicious dairy-free option and that they customized theirs with extra pineapple.
quotes: Some of my favorites: Summer Roles with shrimp and chicken with gf sauce, Chicken Fried Rice, ANY CURRY - this day I got Sunrise Curry (with no onions and extra pineapple), and finished it off with a Sweet Mango Sticky Rice

The summer rolls are fresh, light, and full of flavor

topProducts.name: Green Papaya Salad

quotes: The green papaya salad is the best in town  and the Singapore noodles with steak is loaded with fresh vegetables, delectable turmeric noodles and thin sliced steak

highlightedReviews.author: Christina Althoff
highlightedReviews.text: This is my favorite place in the Minneapolis area to go for vegan pho and tofu spring rolls!! Their broth is SO flavorful and their tofu in the pho and spring rolls is so delicious! Great atmosphere and great service!!

highlightedReviews.author: Sandy
highlightedReviews.text:
LOVE, love, love !!! üíñ‚ú®üíñ Wok In The Park has lots of DELICIOUS gluten free and dairy free options for me!!! Some of my favorites: Summer Roles with shrimp and chicken with gf sauce, Chicken Fried Rice, ANY CURRY - this day I got Sunrise Curry (with no onions and extra pineapple), and finished it off with a Sweet Mango Sticky Rice. YUM

I so appreciate delicious GF & DF options ‚Ä¶  soooooo many options!!!!! Their team is HELPFUL , kind, and fun. I typically order take-out and share with others. THANKS Wok In The Park! üíñ‚ú®üíñ

highlightedReviews.author: Timothy Olson
highlightedReviews.text: I'm not the best person to review the food here, as I was on a diet and only ate a bird-like portion. However, what I did have was delicious, and my friend was raving about his meal. What truly made this place special was the amazing staff. The servers were absolutely fantastic, and despite the place being small, it was clear it's very well-loved and constantly busy. We enjoyed the little bit of outside seating, and the prices were completely reasonable. If I lived in the area, I'd be back often. Next time, my diet is taking a day off.

highlightedReviews.author: Kelsey Molloy
highlightedReviews.text: AMAZING! We were in the area and decided to finally try this place out. Had a little bit of a wait but the vibe is very chill. Staff were so friendly/kind. THE FOOD WAS AMAZING. The best wontons I‚Äôve ever had. The calamari was to die for. Entrees were large portion sized and so delicious. Definitely recommend. We will be coming back!!

highlightedReviews.author: Paul Park
highlightedReviews.text: Wow! We literally loved everything!  Our family was visiting from Iowa. Right when we walked in they made us feel special. The atmosphere was great. It was busy, but in a good way. Like everyone working hard, smiling, eating great food and happy. The food was amazing, served quickly, and the portions are huge! I‚Äôve eaten a ton of crab rangoons in my life, but none that were cutely made to look like crabs. Our server Brittany was awesome too!  Incredible experience thank you. üôè

highlightedReviews.author: Bridgette
highlightedReviews.text: Wok in the Park is hands down one of the best Asian bistros in the area! We've been coming here for awhile, and it never disappoints!! The Fresh Summer Rolls are always a hit, the classic Fried Rice is perfectly cooked, and the Sweet and Sour Chicken is absolutely amazing. It can get a little busy around dinner time, so I definitely recommend making a reservation. The food is consistently delicious, and the staff is incredibly friendly. I‚Äôll definitely be back and will be bringing new customers with me!!!!

highlightedReviews.author: Julie Klapak
highlightedReviews.text: This is our go-to celebration restaurant! Frankly, the best Asian food I've ever had. Space is a bit tight, but the atmosphere is cozy without feeling restrictive. The staff are all lovely and incredibly welcoming; their rendition of Happy Birthday was genuinely *hauntingly beautiful.* Often busy at popular times, but absolutely worth the wait. Portions are always large and steaming hot. Cannot recommend them enough!

highlightedReviews.author: Rebecca Neumann
highlightedReviews.text:
Stumbled upon by accident waiting for jewelers appointment. (Eloquent jewelers..also wonderful people) Had lunch; so good they don't even need to give you soy sauce. and the people were the best I've experienced in a long while. truly flavorful and delicious and they'll make it calm or spicy. I don't like spice.
will drive the 40 miles back there again. Thank you!

highlightedReviews.author: Greg Lamothe
highlightedReviews.text: The lunch specials are generous portions with exceptional food. I had the Beef Pad Thai with Hot & Sour Soup and an Egg Roll. The hot and sour soup was exceptional with its fresh ingredients and delectable flavor. The Pad Thai was rich with a very tasteful sauce, although definitely lacking heat (even though I had requested extra spicy and said, "I not referring to Minnesota style"). The egg roll was fresh, crisp, and very tasteful. The service was excellent and the decor was classic modern. Other than the lack of heat on the Pad Thai it was an exceptional lunch. I highly recommend this place. It will be my go-to Asian restaurant, when I'm nearby.

highlightedReviews.author: Julie Hanson
highlightedReviews.text: The food here is amazing and lots of gluten free options - the wait is long and reservations are highly recommended. The order ahead and pick up system needs some improvements tho - waited 25 minutes on hold just to learn a pick up slot wasn‚Äôt available for an hour. Definitely recommend adding that to the voicemail message Or implementing online ordering.
